node.title: Backpacker tells inquest Theo Hayez didn't appear drunk on the night he disappeared in Byron Bay
node.description: Inquest hears the missing backpacker was sober enough to talk about European politics before GoogleÂ searching a small village seldom known to tourists.
node.content:
["A backpacker who was with Theo Hayez at a Byron Bay nightclub on the night he disappeared has told a coronial inquest he didn\u2019t think the young Belgian traveller\u00a0was affected by alcohol.", "A key question in the two-week coronial inquest is whether Theo Hayez was alone and lost when he took a secluded bush track to Tallow Beach, or whether he was with someone or had a reason to travel towards Cape Byron Lighthouse on the night of May 31, 2019.", "Alexander \u201cSander\u201d Stadegaard was the first overseas witness to give evidence, as the two-week inquest entered its third day.", "He was with a small group of backpackers who caught a shuttle bus from the Wake-Up hostel where Theo was staying to the Cheeky Monkeys nightclub in the Byron CBD.", "", "
State Coroner, Teresa O'Sullivan (left) with Counsel Assisting Kirsten Edwards (middle) visited the Cheeky Monkey's Bar, where Theo Hayez, was last seen.(Supplied: Matt Coble)
", "The inquest has previously heard security guards kicked Theo out around 11:00pm because he was \u201capproaching intoxication,\u201d however the court has heard he only bought two beers at Cheeky Monkeys and it is unlikely he drank excessively prior to leaving the hostel.", "Mr Stadegaard said he sat down next to Theo in a booth and they had a discussion about politics.", "\u201cIt would have been\u00a0quite a short conversation\u2026 but I can remember we talked about politics, European politics and Belgian politics,\u201d he said.", "\u201cHe explained to me how Belgian politics worked and we talked about the European Union.\u201d", "Mr Stadegaard said he did not notice anything about Theo to suggest he was affected by alcohol.", "He told the Counsel Assisting the Coroner Kirsten Edwards that he agreed with comments made in his earlier statement that he did not think Theo was drunk, because it was not the kind of conversation you would have while drunk.", "
Court hears Theo searched for small village on night he disappeared
", "The lawyer for Theo\u2019s family, David Evenden, told the inquest Theo had done a Google search for \u2018Coraki\u2019 \u2013 a small village about an hour's\u00a0drive south-west of Byron Bay \u2013 shortly after sitting down in the booth.", "\u201cBut it appears he did this search shortly after sitting down next to you in the booth.", "\u201cDo you have any memory at all of discussing a place called Coraki with Theo?\u201d", "", "
Theo Hayez has been described as a friendly, fun man who wasn't a heavy drinker or drug user.(Supplied)
", "Mr Stadegaard, who was only in Byron Bay for one day, said he did not have any recollection of the name, nor did he remember talking to Theo about it, or looking at any maps.", "The State Coroner Teresa\u00a0O'Sullivan thanked Mr Stadegaard for his time and the court was adjourned until this afternoon when it is expected to hear from three more overseas witness \u2013 all of whom were staying at the Wake Up! Hostel with Theo and were at the Cheeky Monkeys on the night he disappeared.", "
Differing opinions on fate of Theo
", "The\u00a018-year-old was last seen leaving the Cheeky Monkeys nightclub in Byron Bay on May 31, 2019.", "Mobile phone data revealed Theo searched for directions back to his hostel near Belongil Beach, but then walked in the opposite direction towards Tallow Beach.", "A map of the data shows he stopped for more than 7 minutes at the Tennyson Street cricket nets, before walking down the almost pitch-black Milne Track and turning onto a fire trail before reaching Tallow Beach.", "", "
A map of Theo Hayez's movements, based on mobile phone data.(Supplied: NSW Coroners Court.)
", "Police believe he fell into the ocean while trying to scale the\u00a0grassy Cape Byron lighthouse cliff in the dark and was swept away.", "It's a theory the family find difficult to accept, given Theo was\u00a0cautious and responsible and had an aversion to heavy drinking and drugs and was not a risk taker.", "On Tuesday, the inquest heard evidence from Theo's cousin Lisa Hayez, who said\u00a0\"there's no way\"\u00a0her cousin would have travelled down a dark and secluded bush track in Byron Bay late at night by himself."]
